3: Is this some kind of a joke?!
A loud noise comes out of the laboratory, something other than an explosion, for once. It startles Ayla, who is returning to get more couplets.
W-what's happening?
Ayla carefully opens the door and finds quite a few people inside. Aside from Asimov and Allen, Presiden Hassen and Commander Nikola are also present.
Chairman! And why is Commander Nikola here as well...
How do I put it... I messed up. Commander Nikola was there when I handed in the application to President Hassen, and he immediately came this way after knowing what we've been up to.
We're so done...
Nikola takes a deep breath, trying to contain his anger.
Wasting the precious resources from the Science Council to make these ridiculous things... Why would any of you think that we'll allow it?!
Speaking for the WGAA, hosting activities to promote human civilization and culture is what we do. I don't see what's wrong with it.
Nikola shakes his head, disappointed as if he has wasted his time.
You're on the Council, you should've known your priorities. This isn't time for festivities.
I don't think it's an either-or situation.
Alright. I'm sure that Asimov has his considerations when he accepts this job on behalf of the Science Council.
Facing Hassen's questions, Asimov nods as he continues deciphering the couplets on the floor.
Commander Nikola, do you remember approving the CUB project at the Council a while ago?
Of course! So why are you abandoning that project to do arts and crafts with the WGAA?
These couplets are written by the AI system of the CUB used in previous tests...
Huh, isn't that interesting, Nikola?
Nikola does not appear to find it interesting.
Therefore, the Science Council has deemed it necessary to analyze and restore these couplets to better calibrate the AI system.
Just so happens, we also want to deliver the couplets to different squads and departments to lift their spirits during Lunar New Year.
Even so, I still don't agree to waste our time on this matter.
As the tension mounts, a smiling young man walks out from a corner to Nikola's side.
Commander, I have a question for Asimov, if you don't mind?
Despite looking impatient, Nikola signals Murray to ask his question with a look.
Although I don't know how this... CUB works, but from what I understand, many Construct squads are not willing to use them currently.
You're right. Celica did a survey earlier, and many Constructs were worried about the stability of their M.I.N.D.s when connecting directly to its AI system...
Catching Murray's intent, Ayla quickly follows.
Therefore, if there's a function that let people understand the CUBs more, it'll make the squad members trust them more.
Nikola picks up one of the couplets and takes a look.
...With this? Nevermind. You'll assess how useful this activity is—but only on the basis that other R&D projects and missions won't be affected.
Right, in that case, let's also put these couplets up outside the Council and the Commander's room.
Are you serious...
Haha, why not? If we set an example to embrace new things, I'm certain the other squads will follow suit.
With Nikola's tacit approval, Ayla immediately takes out the couplets she prepared with a grin.
Leave the decorating to WGAA! We're efficient, and it won't interrupt your work at all!
...You better be.
With their approval, Ayla leaves the room as quickly as she can, as if staying for another second would risk Nikola going back on his words.
What a mess...
Let it go. It's the New Year—the young people should move around more... Now, the rest of us still have some things to take care of.
True. We've wasted too much time here. There is still plenty to discuss and decide for next year's battle plan.
Hassen and Nikola leave the laboratory first, followed by Murray, who says goodbye to Asimov and Allen with a smile.
I should also go, then. Keep up with your work, gentlemen!
I guess I should thank you for your help. And... Happy New Year.
Murray looks a little surprised by Allen's gratitude, but he quickly composes himself.
Of course. Happy New Year to you as well.
Murray gives them a slight bow before turning around and walking out of the room after Hassen and Nikola. He is smiling, albeit peculiarly.
(—Indeed, there's much to happen this year. I've got to be prepared.)
